metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7308 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernel before 4.20.6 performs undesirable out-of-bounds speculation on pointer arithmetic in various cases, including cases of different branches with different state or limits to sanitize, leading to side-channel attacks. Jann Horn discovered that the eBPF implementation in the Linux kernel was insufficiently hardened against Spectre V1 attacks. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Mitigation for this vulnerability is available by setting the kernel.unprivileged_bpf_disabled sysctl to 1: $ sudo sysctl kernel.unprivileged_bpf_disabled=1 $ echo kernel.unprivileged_bpf_disabled=1 | \ sudo tee /etc/sysctl.d/90-CVE-2019-7308.conf This issue is mitigated on systems that use secure boot, thanks to the kernel lockdown feature which blocks BPF program loading.

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-21.21').
